a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Air pollution vs. GDP per capita, 1700 to 2015
Levels of air pollution, measured as suspended particulate matter (micrograms per cubic metre) vs. GDP per capita
(2011 international-$). Here, data for London and Delhi GDP levels are assumed to be in line with national average
values for the UK and India.
Data source: Fouquet (2011) and Gov. of India; Maddison and World Bank
